授業方法:
Face-to-face lectures. 

Lecture format. All sessions will be held on the basis of Power Point Presentations covering the topics listed below for each session. PPP files or PDF files will be uploaded before each session on LUNA.
Students are expected to prepare for each class on the basis of the handed out files and/or selected texts distributed in advance.

第1回:
Economic history as an interdisciplinary subject: 

Its topics, approaches and methods.
第2回:
The European Economy in the Middle Ages I:


From the Agricultural Revolution to Early Forms of Capitalistic Production
第3回:
The European Economy in the Middle Ages II: 


The Venetian Traders and the Hanseatic League
第4回:
The European Economy in the Early Modern Age: 


Colonial Expansion
第5回:
The European Economy in the 16th Century I: 


Colonial expansion - Spain and Portugal
第6回:
The European Economy in the 16th century II: 


Colonial expansion - other European Countries
第7回: The European Economy in 17th Century I: From Colonial Expansion to Mercantilism - The Netherlands and Europe in the 17th Century
第8回: The European Economy in 17th century II: Mercantilism in France, England and other Countries
第9回: The Industrial Revolution I: England, Belgium, the Netherlands and Germany
第10回: The Industrial Revolution II: Europe’s Economy in the 18th century
第11回: Europe’s Economy in the 19th Century: Economic and Social Developments
第12回: Early Integration of the World Economy until 1914
第13回: The 1st World War, the Great Depression and Europe’s Economy in the Interwar Period
第14回: European economy in the 1940s: The Economy during the Second World War, War Destruction and Early Post-war Attempts for Reconstruction

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school.
By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
European Studies:
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.

備考　Note
Evaluation will be based on mini tests conducted at the end of each lecture. The mini test will raise one or two questions regarding the lecture's content. At least 8 mini tests (with an average of at least 60%) have to be handed in for receiving the credits for this course.
